translated: The Collection of Long Sayings .
The Questions of the Youth Jatukaṇṇi
“Having heard the hero who has gone beyond desire,
(thus said the venerable Jatukaṇṇi)
I have come to ask about the one who has crossed the flood;
Please tell me, O leader of the people,
The truth, O Blessed One, please tell me this.
For the Blessed One dwells having overcome desire,
Like the sun with its radiance on the earth;
For me of limited wisdom, O you of great wisdom,
Please explain the Dhamma that I may understand;
The complete abandonment of birth and old age here.”
“Control the attachment to sensual pleasures,
(the Blessed One said to Jatukaṇṇi)
Seeing renunciation as safe;
Whether grasped or ungrasped,
Let nothing disturb you.

original: Yaṁ pubbe taṁ visosehi,🔽pacchā te māhu kiñcanaṁ;
analyzed: yam pubbe tam visosehi  pacchā te mā āhuḥ kiñcana
translated: Whatever was before, purify that;🔽Do not have anything in the future;
If you do not grasp in the middle,
You will wander in peace.
In all of name-and-form,
For the brahmin who is free from attachment,
His effluents do not exist,

analyzed: yā ihi mat cuvasam vaja iti
translated: By which he would come under the control of death.”
The Questions of the Youth Jatukaṇṇi is the eleventh.
